I have an existing test case class which I extended to add few more test
cases. When I run the extended test case, it runs the test cases from the
base class as well. Is there a flag or something which I can use to suppress
running test cases present in the base class.
   Here's an example of the scenario :
          
            class A extends TestCase
            {
                public testA() {}
            }
 
            class B extends A
            {
                public testB() {}
            }
 
  When I execute class B, it runs both testA() and testB(), which I want to
avoid for now. I need to extend to be able to use the setup/teardown done by
A.
 
-alok
